name: Erbium(III) chloride
desc: Erbium(III) chloride, the erbium(III) salt of hydrochloric acid, is a violet solid used for the preparation of erbium metal.

images.alt: Erbium(III) chloride hydrate photographed in sunlight

Appearance:
violet hygroscopic monoclinic crystals (anhydrous)
pink hygroscopic crystals (hexahydrate)
Solubility in water:
soluble in water (anhydrous)
slightly soluble in ethanol (hexahydrate)[1]
